line_1: Jecur they burn, and Cor they pierce,
line_2: As either best supplies their Verse:

line_1: Gives balm for all the thorns that pierce,
line_2: His muse, bright angel of his verse,
Pour'd o'er a tender parent's hearse,

line_1: Sin' that day MICHAEL did you pierce,
line_2: But a' your doings to rehearse,

line_1: Sin' that day MICHAEL did you pierce,
line_2: Your wily snares an' fechtin fierce,

line_1: Sin' that day MICHAEL did you pierce,
line_2: Wad ding a' Lallan tongue, or Erse,

line_1: Oft o'er thy lovely daughters, hapless PIERCE!
line_2: Her sighs shall breathe, her sorrows dew their hearse. —
Like lightning, let his mighty verse

line_1: He who thro' vast Immensity can pierce,
line_2: See worlds on worlds compose one Universe,

line_1: Your Honor's hearts wi' grief 'twad pierce
line_2: Alas! my roupet Muse: is haerse!

line_1: Your Honor's hearts wi' grief 'twad pierce
line_2: To see her sittan on her arse

line_1: Your Honor's hearts wi' grief 'twad pierce
